adventure_overview: Everyone has differences, and everyone faces challenges. That’s what makes us human. In this Adventure, you’ll learn about the challenges other people face by looking at the world through their eyes. The more you understand, the more helpful you can be — and the more you can show your friends how to be nice to everyone, including people who are different. After all, we are all different in one way or another. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Do an activity that shows the challenges of a being visually impaired.

activities.name: Can We Get There?
activities.description: Navigate an obstacle course with both eyes covered one eye covered, and blurred vision.

activities.name: Can You Draw It?
activities.description: Draw a picture while vision is obscured.

activities.name: I Can Do It
activities.description: Pour a cup of water and eat a snack without using vision.

activities.name: What Is This?
activities.description: Identify common household items without using vision.

requirements.text: Do an activity that shows the challenges of being hearing impaired.

activities.name: Listen Carefully
activities.description: Play a game of Simon Says wearing noise canceling headphones.

activities.name: Story Time
activities.description: Tell a story using American Sign Language.

activities.name: What Animal
activities.description: Cub Scout guess the animal without talking.

requirements.text: Meet someone who has a disability or someone who works with people with disabilities about what obstacles they must overcome and how they do it.

activities.name: How Do You Do It?
activities.description: Invite a guest to speak about disabilities.

activities.name: Jobs For Dogs
activities.description: Have a person who trains service dogs or has a service dog visit the den.
